For testing complex SQL queries I use a combination of DBUnit and HSQLDB. D=
BUnit (http://dbunit.sourceforge.net) is used to populate the database, whi=
ch is a HSQLDB  (http://hsqldb.org) instance fired up in the same VM as the=
 test case. Hibernate's SchemaExport tool is useful to create tables, etc.
=

Of course, these are not strict, fast-running unit tests, but more of slow=
er functional ones (let's say they take ten seconds instead of one). The ni=
ce thing is that they're isolated enough that you don't need an external da=
tabase to run them.

-----Original Message-----
Arash Bijanzadeh wrote:
>
>=
 I have a problem with the test dependencies. The application is a
> databa=
se backed application and I want to test the db functionality.
> For this p=
urpose, first thing to be done is database populating which
> itself is a t=
est suite. Is there any way to specify the order or tests
> in Junit? Or an=
y other solution which suits this kind of scenarios?
> Thanks in advance,
>=
 Arash
>
